conclusion: Determine which container the liquid from A, B, and C will flow into.
Liquid A (light blue) flows downward directly through the light blue block.
Liquid A passes between the light blue block and the green block and continues downward without any obstructions.
Liquid B (green) flows downward from the green block and continues straight down.
Liquid B passes between the green block and the red block.
Liquid B flows directly into the container.
Liquid C (pink) flows downward from the pink block and passes between the pink block and the yellow block.
Liquid C continues downward, passing between the yellow block and the red block.
Liquid C flows directly into the container.
Liquid A flows into Container E.
Liquid B flows into Container F.
Liquid C flows into Container F.
Liquid A flows into Container E.
Liquid B flows into Container F.
Liquid C flows into Container F.
The liquid from A, B, and C will flow into Containers E and F.
Liquid A will flow into Container E, while liquids B and C will flow into Container F.
